title: [BUG] (preview-3.1) SKCanvas.TotalMatrix has (TransX, TransY) swapped with (Persp0, Persp1)
body:
### Description

In preview-3.1, `SKCanvas.TotalMatrix` is not returning the correct value. 

I have to run the following to fix the value:
```cs
(matrix.TransX, matrix.TransY) = (matrix.Persp0, matrix.Persp1);
(matrix.Persp0, matrix.Persp1) = (0f, 0f);
```

### Code

If you run the following code:

```cs
Canvas.Save();
Canvas.ResetMatrix();
Console.WriteLine($"BEFORE Canvas.TotalMatrix = {Canvas.TotalMatrix.Values.Select(x => x.ToString()).Join(", ")}");
Canvas.Translate(100, 100);
Console.WriteLine($"AFTER Canvas.TotalMatrix = {Canvas.TotalMatrix.Values.Select(x => x.ToString()).Join(", ")}");
Canvas.Restore();
```

It prints:
```
BEFORE Canvas.TotalMatrix = 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1
AFTER Canvas.TotalMatrix = 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 100, 100, 1
```

The docs for SKMatrix.Values
```
Gets or sets the matrix as a flat array: [ScaleX, SkewX, TransX, SkewY, ScaleY, TransY, Persp0, Persp1, Persp2].
```

so `Persp0` and `Persp1` have the values for `TransX` and `TransY` In previous versions (preview-2.1 and below), it would print:

```
BEFORE Canvas.TotalMatrix = 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1
AFTER Canvas.TotalMatrix = 1, 0, 100, 0, 1, 100, 0, 0, 1
```
